## Overview

This page presents selected **professional** projects and **MBA** case studies that combine
engineering, operations, finance, and digital transformation.

Each case study highlights the **context**, **my role**, the **tools and
frameworks** used, and the **key learnings**.

---

## Professional Projects

::: {.section-card}

<details open>
<summary><strong>Concrete Pipes Market Expansion – Truck-Mounted & Stationary Pumps (China–Mexico, 2019)</strong></summary>

<span id="pipes"></span>

**Context:**  
After massive steel imports from China and a booming market 
driven by competitors, Mexican concrete pumping customers needed 
more competitive prices on pipe systems for both truck-mounted and 
stationary pumps (lay-down and high-rise applications), creating an 
opportunity to find new partners to maintain market share.

**My Role:**  
Commercial lead and project manager for identifying, analazing and 
developing a new international supplier.

**What I did:**

- Research, identified and evaluated Chinese steel pipes manufacturers 
for concrete pumps.  
- Coordinated technical validation with service teams and key customers.  
- Structured pricing, margin, and inventory proposals for the Mexican market.  
- Prepared commercial materials, technical training and supported sales 
teams during launch.

**Results / Impact:**

- Increase the company’s **market share by approximately 25%** in the
concrete pipe segment.  
- Contributed to an estimated **15% increase in sales** for this product
line.  
- Strengthened the company’s position in both **truck-mounted** and
**stationary pump** projects.

</details>

:::


::: {.section-card}

<details>
<summary><strong>Lubricants Distributor Financial Analysis – Mobil Exxon vs Shell (Mexico, 2017)</strong></summary>

<span id="lubricants"></span>

**Context:**  
Aftermarket management needed to choose the best long-term partner between two
lubricant distributors (Mobil Exxon vs Shell) for parts and service in construction and
mining equipment customers.

**My Role:**  
Consultant analyst commercial and financial evaluation.

**What I did:**

- Performed **ratio and trend analysis** (profitability, liquidity,
leverage, efficiency).  
- Reviewed historical sales volumes, margins, and payment behaviour.   
- Presented an **executive summary** with risks, opportunities, and
recommendations.

**Results / Impact:**

- Provided a structured, data-driven resport comparison that clarified the
financial and operational differences between the two alternatives.  
- Decision-making support by selecting the distributor with better 
credit behaviour, stronger growth potential, and profitability.

</details>

:::


::: {.section-card}

<details>
<summary><strong>National Retrofit Campaign – Truck-Mounted Concrete Pumps (Mexico, 2016)</strong></summary>

<span id="retrofit"></span>

**Context:**  
Putzmeister brand in its main product the truck-mounted concrete pumps (sold in 2014–2015) 
required a **turret retrofit** to prevent failures and ensure long-term reliability.

**My Role:**  
Supervisor for the national retrofit campaign.

**What I did:**

- Worked with the PM factory to define technical scope, and procedures.  
- Built a national **schedule** and **risk plan** for all affected units and clients.  
- Negotiated downtime windows with customers to minimize disruption.  
- Coordinated service teams, spare parts, and documentation.

**Results / Impact:**

- Completed the campaign across the national fleet using **project 
crashing techniques**, resulting in a reduction of the overall timeline by 
about **10 days**  
- Improved customer trust and confidence  
- Strengthened collaboration between service, parts, and sales teams.

</details>

:::

## MBA Academic Projects

::: {.section-card}

<details>
<summary><strong>Digital Transformation Strategy – Lumen5 (CMPT 641)</strong></summary>

**Focus:**  
Analysis and evaluation on how Lumen5 can move from a creator-oriented freemium 
tool to an enterprise-grade video platform.

**My Role:**  
Co-author of recommendations and roadmap, lead for **Ecosystem Growth**
recommendation.

**Key Points:**

- Used **Sociotechnical Systems (STS)** and **TOE** frameworks to analyze
misalignments between the product, organization, and market.  
- The recomendation of a re-positioning strategy which focuses on 
**governance, ROI, security, and scalability** for marketing teams (enterprise).  
- Designed a **24-month roadmap** including partnerships, integrations, 
and data-driven value.  

**Impact / Learning:**

- Developed a stronger understanding of how to connect **technical
capabilities**, **business model**, and **organizational change**.

</details>

:::


::: {.section-card}

<details>
<summary><strong>400 kW Rooftop Solar Power Plant – Project Management Plan</strong></summary>

**Focus:**  
Created a full project management plan for a 400 kW rooftop solar power
plant.

**My Role:**  
Project planning and scheduling.

**Key Elements:**

- Built a **Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)** and **Risk Breakdown Structure
(RBS)**.  
- Developed a detailed **schedule** in ProjectLibre with task dependencies,
critical path, ES/EF/LS/LF, and slack.  
- Assigned resources (labor, equipment, materials) and estimated total
duration and budget.  
- Performed basic **project crashing** analysis to reduce the duration by
5 business days.

**Impact / Learning:**

- Practiced applying project management tools to a real-world renewable
energy context.  
- Strengthened skills in risk management, scheduling, and cost/time trade-offs.

</details>

:::

---

## How These Projects Connect

::: {.section-card}

Across both professional and academic projects, my work follows the same pathway:

- **Integration of technical and business thinking**  
- **Data-driven decision-making** (KPIs, experiments)  
- **Project and risk management** in complex operations   

These experiences reflect my MBA approach: applying  
**AI, analytics, and structured project management** to create practical,
measurable results in real organizations.

:::
